alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Western Crook (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 1:55PM MST until February 20 at 5:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...WIDESPREAD HEAVY SNOW AND DANGEROUSLY COLD TEMPERATURES EXPECTED... .Ongoing snow across portions of northeastern Wyoming and western South Dakota will taper off late this afternoon. Late tonight into early tomorrow, the first of two rounds of snow is expected to impact the area, primarily affecting far northwestern South Dakota and higher elevations of the northern of central Black Hills. More widespread heavy snow arrives late Tuesday into Wednesday, with several inches of snow expected area-wide. The combination of heavy snow and breezy winds will lead to dangerous or impossible travel conditions across northeastern Wyoming and western South Dakota through early Thursday. Dangerously cold Arctic air will accompany the snow, with wind chills as low as 30 to 40 below zero expected across the area Wednesday morning through at least Thursday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM TUESDAY TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Northern Campbell County, Western Crook County and Northeastern Crook County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 5 PM Tuesday to 11 AM MST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Dangerously cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes beginning Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Western Crook
